recipes.title: Khachapuri
recipes.description: Cheese-filled Georgian bread, a national favorite.
recipes.instructions: 1. Mix flour, yeast, sugar, salt, milk, and butter to form dough. Let rise for 1 hour. 2. Roll out dough and fill with crumbled cheese. 3. Shape into a boat and bake at 200°C for 15 minutes. 4. Crack an egg in the center and bake for 5 more minutes. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Khinkali
recipes.description: These savory dumplings are stuffed with spiced meat (usually beef and pork) and are a staple of Georgian cuisine.
recipes.instructions:
Combine meat, onions, garlic, cumin, salt, and pepper to make the filling.
Make dough by mixing flour, water, and salt; knead and let rest.

recipes.title: Lobio
recipes.description: A hearty and flavorful dish, Lobio is a stew made from red kidney beans, spices, and herbs.
recipes.instructions:
Cook beans in boiling water until tender (about 1 hour).
In a pan, sauté onions and tomatoes with olive oil, coriander, and cumin.
Add the cooked beans to the pan, stir well, and cook for 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Chakapuli
recipes.description: A traditional spring dish, Chakapuli is a tender lamb stew flavored with tarragon, garlic, and white wine.
recipes.instructions:
Sauté onions and garlic in a pot, then add lamb and brown on all sides.
Pour in white wine, add tarragon, parsley, salt, and pepper.
Simmer on low heat for 1.5 hours, adding water if needed, until lam

recipes.title: Satsivi
recipes.description: Satsivi is a rich and creamy chicken dish served in a flavorful walnut sauce, often enjoyed during festive meals.
recipes.instructions:
Boil the chicken until tender, then shred it.
In a pan, sauté onions and garlic, then add walnuts, chicken broth, and spices.
Simmer the sauce for 20 minutes, then blend until smooth.
Pour sauce over

recipes.title: Mchadi
recipes.description: A simple and hearty cornbread, Mchadi is often served as a side dish to stews or with cheese and sour cream.
recipes.instructions:
Mix cornmeal, flour, salt, and baking powder in a bowl.
Gradually add water and oil, mixing into a dough.
Shape into small patties and fry in a hot pan until golden brown on both sides.
